entry.title: Block Storage Volumes Timeouts and Errors in FRA1
entry.content:
Sep 8, 10:39 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issue with Block Storage Volumes in FRA1 and is monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

Sep 8, 08:03 UTC
Update - Our Engineering team is working on implementing a fix for the issue impacting over FRA1 Block Storage Volumes and is likely to be resolved soon. A subset of impacted Droplets and related products in FRA1 would be having issues with power cycle events. Before attempting power cycle or or power on, please power off the Droplets then detach the Volume.

Sep 8, 00:20 UTC
Identified - Our engineers have identified the cause of the block storage Volumes in FRA1 issue and are actively working on a fix.

We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

Sep 7, 23:44 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. However, it has come to our attention that any Droplets or other services with FRA1 Volumes attached should not be power cycled. Power cycling a Droplet or other service with a FRA1 Volume attached may result in the Droplet not being able to power back on until it is detached.

Sep 7, 22:29 UTC
Investigating - Our engineering team is investigating an issue with block storage Volumes in FRA1. At this time, users may experience issues accessing their Volumes including any read / write operations.

We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

entry.title: App Platform Deployments
entry.content:
Sep 1, 21:23 UTC
Resolved - Our engineering team has resolved the issue impacting App Platform deployments, and all new deployments/updates should now be functioning as expected. Thank you for your patience throughout this process. If you should experience any further issues, please open a ticket with our support team right away.

Sep 1, 20:29 UTC
Monitoring - Our engineering team was able to identify the cause of the issue with App Platform deployments and a fix has been put in place. We are monitoring the situation again and will post an update as soon as the issue is confirmed to be fully resolved.

Sep 1, 18:12 UTC
Identified - During the monitoring phase, our engineers observed recurring problems with App platform deployments. During this time, some users may experience delays when deploying new Apps or when deploying updates to existing Apps. We are actively working to find a quick resolution for these issues and we will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

Sep 1, 13:04 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team has implemented a fix for the issues impacting the App Platform deployments. We are now monitoring the situation closely and will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved. Thank you for your patience!

Sep 1, 11:26 UTC
Identified - Our Engineering team has identified the cause of the issue with App Platform Deployments and is actively working on a fix. We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

Sep 1, 10:44 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Sep 1, 10:06 UTC
Investigating - Our Engineering team identified issues with App Platform Deployments in all regions. During this time, App Platform users may experience delays when deploying new Apps or when deploying updates to existing Apps. Existing Apps should continue to function normally in their current state. We apologize for the inconvenience, and we'll share an update once we have more information.

entry.title: Block Storage Volumes Timeouts and Errors in NYC1
entry.content:
Aug 31, 22:25 UTC
Resolved - Our engineering team has resolved the issue with NYC1 Block Storage Volumes, and writing these Volumes should now be operating normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Aug 31, 22:06 UTC
Monitoring - Our engineers have applied a fix, and are monitoring an issue where Block Storage Volumes in our NYC1 region were timing out or showing errors when being written to.

We will post an update as soon as additional information is available.

entry.title: MongoDB Managed Databases Maintenance
entry.content:
Aug 27, 20:40 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Aug 27, 20:23 UTC
Update - Scheduled maintenance is still in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Aug 27, 20:10 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Aug 27, 20:05 UTC
Scheduled - During the above window, our engineering team will be making changes to our MongoDB Managed Databases in SFO3 to improve performance.

Expected Impact:

All create and destroy events, as well as adding and removing users for MongoDB Managed Databases in our SFO3 region will be temporarily disabled during maintenance.

We do not anticipate any impact for existing MongoDB Managed Databases.

entry.title: Droplet Events in AMS2
entry.content:
Aug 18, 20:15 UTC
Resolved - Our Engineering team has completely resolved the issues affecting Droplet events in our AMS2 region and all events should now be processing normally. Thanks for your patience throughout this process. If you continue to experience problems, then please open a ticket with our support team from within your Cloud Control Panel.

Aug 18, 19:56 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team has implemented a fix to resolve the issues with Droplet events in our AMS2 region and is currently monitoring the situation. We will post an update as soon as the issue is fully resolved.

Aug 18, 19:35 UTC
Investigating - Our Engineering team is investigating an issue with processing Droplet Creation, Destroy, and Resize events in our AMS2 region. During this time users may experience failed events when creating, resizing, or deleting Droplets or Droplet-backed services, such as Managed Databases, Managed Kubernetes, Load Balancer, etc. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

entry.title: Managed Database Functionality
entry.content:
Aug 17, 18:44 UTC
Resolved - Our Engineering team has resolved the issue affecting the Managed Database service. The deployment and resize events are now getting completed with maximum success rate. We appreciate your patience during the process and if you continue to experience difficulties, please open a ticket with our Support team for further review.

Aug 17, 18:11 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team has deployed a fix to resolve the issues affecting our Managed Databases product component. The creation and resize events for the MongoDB clusters should now be functioning normally. We are continuing to monitor the situation and will share an update once the matter is completely resolved.

Aug 17, 17:44 UTC
Investigating - Our Engineering team is investigating an issue impacting our Managed Databases product. During this time, users may experience delays during the deployment and resize events for MongoDB clusters from the Cloud Control Panel. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have further information.

entry.title: Managed Databases Functionality
entry.content:

Aug 16, 12:50 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team has observed that the issues with Managed Databases accessibility and management on our platform are largely fixed. We are continuing to monitor the situation closely. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share another update once the matter is fully resolved.

Aug 16, 12:24 UTC
Identified - Our Engineering team has identified an issue impacting our Managed Databases product. During this time, users may experience errors on the Database page in the Cloud Panel. Users may also notice 5xx errors when performing CRUD actions on the Managed Databases via API. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share an update once we have more information.

entry.title: Networking maintenance in NYC3
entry.content:
Aug 14, 08:15 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Aug 14, 05:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Aug 14, 02:59 UTC
Scheduled - To mitigate the network problems in NYC3 we will be performing an emergency software upgrade of routers commencing at 05:00 UTC and concluding at 09:00 UTC on Saturday 14th August 2021. During this time minimal impact is expected, but users may experience brief moments of packet loss or increased latency.

entry.title: Network Outage in NYC3
entry.content:
Aug 14, 07:43 UTC
Resolved - Our Engineering team has resolved the issue with networking in our NYC3 region. Networking service should now be operating normally. If you continue to experience problems, please open a ticket with our support team. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Aug 13, 21:19 UTC
Monitoring - Our Engineering team has implemented a fix for the issues that caused an impact on multiple products. We are continuing to monitor the situation closely. We apologize for the inconvenience and will share another update once the matter is fully resolved.

Aug 13, 20:58 UTC
Identified - Our engineering team has identified the cause of the networking issue with our NYC3 region and is actively working on a fix.
We will post an update as soon as possible

Aug 13, 20:51 UTC
Investigating - Our Engineering team is currently investigating an issue impacting multiple products. During this time, users may experience errors when interacting with Cloud Control Panel, API, and our Community platform. Users may see issues when accessing the Container Registry systems as well. There may be authentication issues for users with Managed Kubernetes clusters. Users may see connectivity issues with their Droplets in the NYC3 region as well. We apologize for any inconvenience and will share more information as soon as it's available.
